page.title: 01BRODICK, ISLE OF ARRAN
page.content: Brodick village nestles in a bay of beauty with the green hills behind and the golden sand of the beach in front. The population make their living from tourism, the land and servicing the community. Less than an hour from the mainland by ferry, the island's population doubles in summer when tourists come to enjoy holidays involving many outdoor pursuits:climbing, riding, cycling and sailing or relaxing on the beach, walking and observing the wealth of wildlife and scenery. Hotels and boarding houses line the main shore but as you follow the road past the shops and turn towards the castle you enter a countryside of forest and grassland rising to heather clad hills with small farms and small holdings in the glens between.
